00025 #define   SD_USE_CRC

00028 // Not all defines are used... yet...
00029 #define   CMD_GO_IDLE_STATE     0   // Reset the SD
00030 #define   CMD_SEND_OP_COND      1   // Activate initialization process
00031 #define   CMD_SEND_IF_COND      8   // Send interface operating condition
00032 #define   CMD_SEND_CSD          9   // Send Card specific data
00033 #define   CMD_SEND_CID          10  // Send Card ID
00034 #define   CMD_STOP_TRANSMISSION 12  // Stop read/write transmission
00035 #define   CMD_SEND_STATUS       13  // Request card send status
00036 #define   CMD_SET_BLOCKLEN      16  // Set block length (in bytes)
00037 #define   CMD_READ_BLOCK        17  // Read a block of data
00038 #define   CMD_WRITE_BLOCK       24  // Write a block of data
00039 #define   CMD_ERASE_BLOCK_START 32  // Set first sector for erase
00040 #define   CMD_ERASE_BLOCK_END   33  // Set last sector for erase
00041 #define   CMD_ERASE             38  // Erase all selected sectors
00042 #define   CMD_READ_OCR          58  // Read OCR register
00043 #define   CMD_CRC_ONOFF         59  // 0 to turn off CRC, 1 to turn on CRC
00044 
00045 #define   APP_CMD               55  // Signal start of application specific command
00046 #define   SD_SEND_OP_COND       41  // Send operation conditions on host side
00047 
00048 #define   R1_IDLE               0x01
00049 #define   R1_ERASE_RESET        0x02
00050 #define   R1_ILLEGAL_CMD        0x04
00051 #define   R1_CRC_ERROR          0x08
00052 #define   R1_ERASE_ERROR        0x10
00053 #define   R1_ADDR_ERROR         0x20
00054 #define   R1_PARAM_ERROR        0x40
00055 
00056 #define   NO_RESPONSE           0xFF
00057 
00058 #define   BLOCK_SIZE            512
00059 #define   FILL_BYTE             0xFF
00060 #define   START_BLOCK           0xFE
00061

00078 // SD_* is already non-reentrant, so a global buffer is... OK...
00079 static uint8_t scratch[32];

00091 uint8_t
00092 SD_Init(void)
00093 {
00094   uint16_t i;
00095   uint8_t res;
00096 
00097   // Delay a buncha clocks
00098   SPI_SSOff();
00099   SD_DelayBytes(20);
00100 
00101   // Check if the card is inserted
00102   if(!SD_CheckForCard())
00103   {
00104     printf("Card NOT found\n");
00105     return 0;
00106   }
00107   printf("Card found\n");
00108 
00109   // Standard init commands
00110   SD_SendCommand(CMD_SEND_IF_COND, 0);
00111   res = SD_GetResponse(scratch, 5);
00112 
00113   SD_SendCommand(CMD_READ_OCR, 0);
00114   res = SD_GetResponse(scratch, 5);
00115 
00116   // Wait for card to init fully
00117   i=0;
00118   do {
00119     SD_SendCommand(CMD_SEND_OP_COND, 0);
00120     res = SD_GetResponse(scratch, 1);
00121     i++;
00122   }while(res && i < 10000);
00123 
00124   if(res) {
00125     printf("  Error: cmd=%02hX, res=%02hX\n", CMD_SEND_OP_COND, res);
00126     return 0;
00127   }
00128 
00129 #ifdef SD_USE_CRC
00130   SD_SendCommand(CMD_CRC_ONOFF, 1);
00131 #else
00132   SD_SendCommand(CMD_CRC_ONOFF, 0);
00133 #endif
00134   res = SD_GetResponse(scratch, 1);
00135   if(res) {
00136     printf("  Error: cmd=%02hX, res=%02hX\n", CMD_SEND_CID, res);
00137     SD_DecodeR1(res);
00138     return 0;
00139   }
00140 
00141 
00142   SD_SendCommand(CMD_SEND_CID, 0);
00143   // 128bits + 16 CRC
00144   res = SD_GetResponse(scratch, 1) || !SD_ReadData(scratch, 18);
00145 
00146   if(res) {
00147     printf("  Error: cmd=%02hX, res=%02hX\n", CMD_SEND_CID, res);
00148     return 0;
00149   }else{
00150     printf("CID: ");
00151     print_hex(scratch, 16);
00152     printf("\n");
00153     //printf(" CRC16: %d\n", SD_CRC16(scratch, 18));
00154   }
00155 
00156 
00157   SD_SendCommand(CMD_SEND_CSD, 0);
00158   // 128bits + 16 CRC
00159   res = SD_GetResponse(scratch, 1) || !SD_ReadData(scratch, 18);
00160 
00161   if(res) {
00162     printf("  Error: cmd=%02hX, res=%02hX\n", CMD_SEND_CID, res);
00163     return 0;
00164   }else{
00165     printf("CSD: ");
00166     print_hex(scratch, 16);
00167     printf("\n");
00168     //printf(" CRC16: %d\n", SD_CRC16(scratch, 18));
00169   }
00170 
00171 
00172   return 1;
00173 }

00188 uint8_t
00189 SD_ReadBlock(uint8_t *buf, uint32_t addr, uint16_t size)
00190 {
00191   uint8_t res;
00192 
00193   // Set the block length... won't work on SDHC
00194   SD_SendCommand(CMD_SET_BLOCKLEN, size);
00195   res = SD_GetResponse(scratch, 1);
00196   if(res) {
00197     printf("  Error: cmd=%02hX, res=%02hX\n", CMD_SET_BLOCKLEN, res);
00198     SD_DecodeR1(res);
00199     return 0;
00200   }
00201 
00202   SD_SendCommand(CMD_READ_BLOCK, addr);
00203   res = SD_GetResponse(scratch, 1);
00204   if(res) {
00205     printf("  Error: cmd=%02hX, res=%02hX\n", CMD_READ_BLOCK, res);
00206     SD_DecodeR1(res);
00207     return 0;
00208   }
00209 
00210   return SD_ReadData(buf, size);
00211 }

00213 
00227 uint8_t
00228 SD_WriteBlock(uint8_t *data, uint32_t addr, uint16_t size)
00229 {
00230   uint8_t res;
00231   uint8_t funcRes = 1;
00232   uint16_t i;
00233   uint16_t crc;
00234 
00235   crc = SD_CRC16(data, (uint32_t)size);
00236 
00237   // Set the block length... won't work on SDHC
00238   SD_SendCommand(CMD_SET_BLOCKLEN, BLOCK_SIZE);
00239   res = SD_GetResponse(scratch, 1);
00240   if(res) {
00241     printf("  Error: cmd=%02hX, res=%02hX\n", CMD_SET_BLOCKLEN, res);
00242     SD_DecodeR1(res);
00243     return 0;
00244   }
00245 
00246   // Tell it we want to write
00247   SD_SendCommand(CMD_WRITE_BLOCK, addr);
00248   res = SD_GetResponse(scratch, 1);
00249   if(res) {
00250     printf("  Error: cmd=%02hX, res=%02hX\n", CMD_WRITE_BLOCK, res);
00251     SD_DecodeR1(res);
00252     return 0;
00253   }
00254 
00255   SPI_SSOn();
00256 
00257   // Send "Start Block" byte
00258   SPI_TrxByte(START_BLOCK);
00259 
00260   // Send data
00261   SPI_SendBlock(data, size);
00262 
00263   // Fill empty space
00264   for(i=size; i<BLOCK_SIZE; i++) {
00265     SPI_TrxByte(FILL_BYTE);
00266   }
00267 
00268   // Send CRC (recalc for fill bytes
00269   crc = SD_CRC16_Fill(crc, FILL_BYTE, BLOCK_SIZE-size);
00270   SPI_TrxByte((uint8_t)(crc>>8));
00271   SPI_TrxByte((uint8_t)crc);
00272 
00273   SPI_SSOff();
00274 
00275   // Response?
00276   res = SD_GetResponse(scratch, 1);
00277   if((res & 0x0F) != 0x05) {
00278     printf("Error: Data rejected (%02hX)\n", res);
00279     SD_DecodeDataRes(res);
00280     funcRes = 0;
00281   }
00282 
00283   SPI_SSOn();
00284 
00285   // Wait for completion
00286   i=0;
00287   do {
00288     res = SPI_TrxByte(0xFF);
00289     i++;
00290   }while(res != NO_RESPONSE && i < 50000);
00291 
00292   SPI_SSOff();
00293 
00294   // Did it take a crazy amount of time?
00295   if(res != NO_RESPONSE) {
00296     printf("  Error: cmd=%02hX, res=%02hX\n", 0xFF, res);
00297     return 0;
00298   }
00299 
00300   return funcRes;
00301 }
00302 
00303 
00316 uint8_t
00317 SD_EraseBlock(uint32_t addr, uint32_t size)
00318 {
00319   uint8_t res;
00320 
00321   SD_SendCommand(CMD_ERASE_BLOCK_START, addr);
00322   res = SD_GetResponse(scratch, 1);
00323   if(res) {
00324     printf("  Error: cmd=%02hX, res=%02hX\n", CMD_ERASE_BLOCK_START, res);
00325     SD_DecodeR1(res);
00326     return 0;
00327   }
00328 
00329   SD_SendCommand(CMD_ERASE_BLOCK_END, addr+size);
00330   res = SD_GetResponse(scratch, 1);
00331   if(res) {
00332     printf("  Error: cmd=%02hX, res=%02hX\n", CMD_ERASE_BLOCK_END, res);
00333     SD_DecodeR1(res);
00334     return 0;
00335   }
00336 
00337 
00338   SD_SendCommand(CMD_ERASE, 0);
00339   res = SD_GetResponse(scratch, 1);
00340   if(res) {
00341     printf("  Error: cmd=%02hX, res=%02hX\n", CMD_ERASE, res);
00342     SD_DecodeR1(res);
00343     return 0;
00344   }
00345 
00346   // Optionally, the card will send a busy token (response R1b)
00347   // Wait until a non-zero response is sent back, indicating 
00348   // that the erase is complete
00349   SPI_SSOn();
00350   while(SPI_TrxByte(0xFF) == 0);
00351   SPI_SSOff();
00352 
00353   return 1;
00354 }

00365 void
00366 SD_DelayBytes(uint16_t bytes) {
00367   while(bytes) {
00368     SPI_TrxByte(0xFF);
00369     bytes--;
00370   }
00371 }

00373 
00382 uint8_t
00383 SD_CheckForCard(void) {
00384   unsigned int i;
00385   
00386   // Reset card and check response (retry x 10)
00387   for(i=0; i<10; i++) {
00388     SD_SendCommand(CMD_GO_IDLE_STATE, 0);
00389     if(SD_GetResponse(scratch, 1) != NO_RESPONSE) {
00390       return 1;
00391     }
00392   }
00393 
00394   return 0;
00395 }

00397 
00410 void
00411 SD_SendCommand(uint8_t command, uint32_t arg) {
00412   uint8_t temp[6]; // Block of data to send
00413   uint8_t i;
00414 
00415   // command is 0 1 x x x x x x
00416   command &= 0x3F;
00417   command |= 0x40;
00418   temp[0] = command;
00419 
00420   // Copy args... not the most optimal?
00421   for(i=1; i<5; i++) {
00422     // AVRs are little endian, data to send is big
00423     temp[i] = ((uint8_t *)&arg)[4-i];
00424   }
00425 
00426   // Last byte is CRC, shifted left 1, last bit set
00427   temp[5] = 0;
00428   temp[5] = (SD_CRC7(temp, 5) << 1) | 0x01;
00429 
00430   //printf(" Sending command:");
00431   //for(i=0; i<6; i++) {
00432   //  printf(" %02X", temp[i]);
00433   //}
00434   //printf("\n");
00435 
00436   SPI_SSOn();
00437 
00438   SPI_TrxByte(0xFF);
00439   SPI_SendBlock(temp, 6);
00440   SPI_TrxByte(0xFF);
00441 
00442   SPI_SSOff();
00443 }

00445 
00459 uint8_t
00460 SD_GetResponse(uint8_t * buf, uint16_t length) {
00461   uint8_t res  = NO_RESPONSE;
00462   uint8_t resx = NO_RESPONSE;
00463   uint8_t i = 0;
00464 
00465   SPI_SSOn();
00466 
00467   while(i < 20 && res == NO_RESPONSE)   {
00468     i++;
00469     res = SPI_TrxByte(0xFF);
00470   }
00471   //printf("  Resp: %02hX", res);
00472   buf[0] = res;
00473 
00474   // Read the rest of the response, up to length
00475   for(i=1; i<length; i++) {
00476     resx = SPI_TrxByte(0xFF);
00477     buf[i] = resx;
00478     //printf(" %02hX", resx);
00479   }
00480 
00481   //printf("\n");
00482 
00483   SPI_SSOff();
00484 
00485   return res; 
00486 }

00488 
00502 uint8_t
00503 SD_ReadData(uint8_t * buf, uint16_t length) {
00504 
00505   uint8_t  res = 0;
00506   uint16_t  i = 0;
00507   uint16_t retryCount = 100;
00508 
00509   SPI_SSOn();
00510 
00511   // Find data start, or error token
00512   do {
00513     res = SPI_TrxByte(0xFF);
00514   }while(res == NO_RESPONSE && retryCount--);
00515 
00516   if(res != START_BLOCK) {
00517     printf("  Error: cmd=%02hX, res=%02hX\n", 0xFF, res);
00518     SD_DecodeDataErr(res);
00519     return 0;
00520   }
00521   
00522   // Data is comin our way...
00523   for(i=0; i<length; i++) {
00524     buf[i] = SPI_TrxByte(0xFF);
00525   }
00526 
00527   SPI_SSOff();
00528 
00529   return 1;
00530 }

00532 
00540 void
00541 SD_DecodeR1(uint8_t res) {
00542 
00543   if(res)
00544     printf("  Error: "); // Padding for all responses
00545 
00546   if(res & 0x80) {
00547     printf("Not an R1 resp\n");
00548     return;
00549   }
00550 
00551   if(res & 0x01)
00552     printf("Card idle\n");
00553   if(res & 0x02)
00554     printf("Erase rst\n");
00555   if(res & 0x04)
00556     printf("Illegal cmd\n");
00557   if(res & 0x08)
00558     printf("CRC\n");
00559   if(res & 0x10)
00560     printf("Erase seq\n");
00561   if(res & 0x20)
00562     printf("Addr\n");
00563   if(res & 0x40)
00564     printf("Param\n");
00565 }

00579 
00587 void
00588 SD_DecodeDataRes(uint8_t res) {
00589 
00590   if(res)
00591     printf("  Error: "); // Padding for all responses
00592 
00593   // Should have x x x 0 s s s 1
00594   if((res & 0x10) || !(res && 0x01)) {
00595     printf("Not a data resp\n");
00596     return;
00597   }
00598 
00599   switch(res & 0x0F) {
00600     case 0x05: // 0 1 0 1
00601       // Data accepted
00602       break;
00603     case 0x0B: // 1 0 1 1
00604       printf("CRC\n");
00605       break;
00606     case 0x0D: // 1 1 0 1
00607       printf("Write\n");
00608       break;
00609     default:
00610       printf("Not a data resp\n");
00611       break;
00612   };
00613 }
00614 
00615 
00623 void
00624 SD_DecodeDataErr(uint8_t res) {
00625 
00626   if(res)
00627     printf("  Error: "); // Padding for all responses
00628 
00629   // Should have 0 0 0 0 x x x x
00630   if(res & 0xF0) {
00631     printf("Not a data err\n");
00632     return;
00633   }
00634 
00635   if(res & 0x01)
00636     printf("Unk\n");
00637   if(res & 0x02)
00638     printf("CC\n");
00639   if(res & 0x04)
00640     printf("ECC\n");
00641   if(res & 0x08)
00642     printf("Range\n");
00643 }

00646 #define CMD_BYTE_LENGTH 6

00657 uint8_t
00658 SD_CRC7(uint8_t * bytes, uint32_t length) {
00659   uint8_t byte, ibit;
00660   uint8_t reg = 0;
00661 
00662   for (byte = 0; byte < length; byte++) {
00663     for (ibit=0; ibit<8; ibit++) {
00664       reg <<= 1;
00665       reg ^= ((((bytes[byte] << ibit) ^ reg) & 0x80) ? 0x9 : 0);
00666     }
00667   }
00668   return reg;
00669 }
00670 
00671 
00672 #define CRC16_POLYN     0x1021
00673 
00681 uint16_t
00682 SD_CRC16(uint8_t * bytes, uint32_t length) {
00683   uint32_t ibyte;
00684   uint8_t  ibit;
00685   uint16_t reg = 0;
00686 
00687 
00688   for (ibyte = 0; ibyte < length; ibyte++) {
00689 
00690     reg ^= ((uint16_t)bytes[ibyte]) << 8;
00691     for (ibit=0; ibit<8; ibit++) {
00692       if(reg & 0x8000) {
00693         reg = (reg << 1) ^ CRC16_POLYN;
00694       }else{
00695         reg <<= 1;
00696       }
00697     }
00698 
00699   }
00700   return (uint16_t)reg;
00701 }
00702 
00715 uint16_t
00716 SD_CRC16_Fill(uint16_t crc, uint8_t const_value, uint32_t length) {
00717   uint32_t ibyte;
00718   uint8_t  ibit;
00719   uint16_t reg = crc;
00720   uint16_t constVal = ((uint16_t)const_value) << 8;
00721 
00722   for (ibyte = 0; ibyte < length; ibyte++) {
00723 
00724     reg ^= constVal;
00725     for (ibit=0; ibit<8; ibit++) {
00726       if(reg & 0x8000) {
00727         reg = (reg << 1) ^ CRC16_POLYN;
00728       }else{
00729         reg <<= 1;
00730       }
00731     }
00732 
00733   }
00734   return (uint16_t)reg;
00735 }
